image.altText: A woman with a little girl sitting on her lap

items.synopsis: Many working Australians simply won't have enough to make ends meet each week, according to new research provided exclusively to the ABC's The Drum.

title.children: Working Australians struggling to afford basic needs, new data shows

image.altText: Woman and young child look at a pile of floral tributes lid at the site of the Hunter Valley bus crash

items.synopsis: Police investigators have found defects in multiple coaches belonging to Linq Buslines, as part of investigations into the deadly bus crash in the NSW Hunter Valley.

title.children: Bus company involved in deadly Hunter Valley crash ordered to fix numerous defects after investigation

image.altText: Liberal Senator David Van

items.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton says Senator David Van has been advised he will not sit in the Liberal party room after receiving further allegations against him following a statement made by Senator Lidia Thorpe in the Senate.

title.children: Peter Dutton dumps Senator David Van from Liberal party room

image.altText: Man working from home in a creative field on his ipad

items.synopsis: Unemployment surprisingly falls back to 3.6 per cent, as an estimated 75,900 jobs are added to the economy.

title.children: Economists tip more rate hikes as jobs numbers smash expectations

image.altText: Aerial footage of the Train's home showing two front steps and water tanks.

items.synopsis: A pre-inquest coronial hearing outlined the investigation will focus on what led to the murder of two police officers and a neighbour at Wieambilla last year.

title.children: Wieambilla neighbour recorded moment he was shot without warning by extremists, court hears

image.altText: A drone shot of rows of houses in Shell Cove, Wollongong's south.

items.synopsis: Australia needs an ambitious national project to fix our housing crisis, researchers say.

title.children: Australia's housing policies make 'the wealthiest the most subsidised cohort' and experts say that needs to change

image.altText: Britain's Prime Minister Boris Johnson speaks during Prime Minister's Questions in the House of Commons in London.

items.synopsis: Boris Johnson said it was a lie to say he deliberately misled parliament, and called the report a charade.

title.children: Boris Johnson deliberately misled UK parliament over COVID-19 lockdown parties, report finds

image.altText: Two men wearing suits and smiling stand side by side in front of a glass window

items.synopsis: The South Australian Labor government has sought to address housing affordability woes and skyrocketing cost-of-living pressures in its second budget.

title.children: Stamp duty relief and billions poured into hospitals in South Australian budget

image.altText: Street sign reading Alfred Hill Drive.

items.synopsis: A jury has found a Canberra man guilty of murdering the "love of his life", siding with the argument of the prosecution that she fell from the bonnet of his car.

title.children: Canberra man found guilty of murdering partner who clung to bonnet of his car

items.synopsis: It was a Sunday afternoon in Port Arthur in 1996 when the three people Walter Mikac loved most were brutally taken from him.

title.children: Nine days after Walter lost his entire family, he sent a letter that helped change the course of Australian history

image.altText: Brad Fittler gestures while speaking to Latrell Mitchell at NSW Blues training before State of Origin game two.

items.synopsis: New South Wales centre Latrell Mitchell will miss the Blues' must-win Origin showdown at Lang Park with a calf injury — the same injury that ruled him out of the series opener.

title.children: Blues superstar Latrell Mitchell ruled out of must-win State of Origin clash

image.altText: A slightly blurry photo shows hundreds of people crammed onto the deck of a blue fishing boat in the ocean.

items.synopsis: The Greek coast guard says efforts by its own ships and merchant vessels to assist the boat were repeatedly rebuffed, with those on board insisting they wanted to continue to Italy.

title.children: Hundreds feared dead as search continues for survivors of migrant boat sinking off Greece

image.altText: A man smiles.

items.synopsis: The yachtsman, winemaker and businessman — who was part of the team that wrested the America's Cup from the United States — dies in Adelaide aged 90.

title.children: Champion yachtsman and wine boss Sir James Hardy dies aged 90

image.altText: A close up photo of Bill Cosby, an African-America comedian.

items.synopsis: One woman alleges that Cosby, claiming to be her acting mentor, lured her from New York to Nevada where she was assaulted.

title.children: Bill Cosby sued by nine women in Nevada for alleged sexual assaults

image.altText: Jeremy Cameron kicks a goal from outside 50 for Geelong

items.synopsis: Can Port Adelaide put a dent in Geelong's finals aspirations, or will the Cats finally put a stop to the Power's winning streak? To find out, follow our live AFL ScoreCentre for all the scores, stats and results.

title.children: AFL live: Cats try to force Power fade in Adelaide

image.altText: Australia cricketer Steve Smith sits with his finger bandaged after copping a hit at training before the Ashes.

items.synopsis: After averaging more than 100 in the last Ashes series in England, Steve Smith says he is hoping to improve on that in the series starting on Friday night.

title.children: Steve Smith shakes off finger blow on Ashes eve, hoping to improve on Bradman-esque 2019 series

image.altText: A man in glasses and a suit stands between Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander flags.

items.synopsis: A lease held by the Russian Federation for an embassy close to Parliament House has been cancelled by the federal government.

title.children: Government rushes through law to stop new Russian embassy being built near Parliament House

image.altText: Man wearing straw hat and black singlet holding crayfish on stern of boat

items.synopsis: In a packed courtroom in Far North Queensland, a man demonstrates how he allegedly gunned down his 'best mate' with a semi-automatic rifle.

title.children: Man holds gun in packed courtroom to demonstrate how he allegedly killed his 'best mate'

image.altText: Alice Springs court generic (2)

items.synopsis: The NT coroner hears how less than a week before a woman's partner lit a house fire that claimed both of their lives, she told police he had threatened to kill her.

title.children: 'You're dead when you come back': DV victim's final police statement played to coronial inquest

image.altText: A man wearing a black cap fixes the collar of Trump's white jumper.

items.synopsis: Many of the familiar faces that surrounded Donald Trump in his final days in the White House have exited his orbit. But there is one man who remained dutifully by his side — and his loyalty may have made him a target of the FBI.

title.children: How the man who was constantly by Trump’s side ended up in court as his co-defendant

image.altText: A picture of the outside of a business in an industrial area

items.synopsis: A teenage boy dies from his injuries after an incident on Thursday morning at the factory where he worked in Perth's south-east.

title.children: Teenager fatally injured at industrial business in Perth is latest in spate of WA workplace deaths

image.altText: A man in hi-vis next to a burnt out car

items.synopsis: Regional NSW towns like Dubbo are witnessing a spike in vehicle thefts, and a series of TikTok trends are seen as a driving force behind it, according to the state's chief crime statistician.

title.children: TikTok trend a driving factor for increase in car thefts in regional NSW, statistician says

image.altText: A man in a suit walks as a microphone is held in his path

items.synopsis: Closing addresses are underway in the case in which Hillsong founder Brian Houston has pleaded not guilty to concealing his father's abuse of a young boy.

title.children: Hillsong founder's 'only focus' was to protect church after father's sexual abuse, court hears

image.altText: A teenager in a beanie looking at a phone

items.synopsis: The latest crime statistics show teenage burglaries in Victoria have increased by a staggering 86 per cent.

title.children: Thieves as young as 10 behind dramatic rise in home burglaries, car theft

image.altText: Woman with curly dark hair and black singlet smiles for the camera on a beach.

items.synopsis: The parents of Simone Strobel, murdered in Lismore in 2005, hope a second inquest into her death will proceed now charges against her then-boyfriend have been withdrawn.

title.children: Parents of murdered backpacker feel 'no closer' to answers after charges withdrawn

image.altText: A pregnant woman using a mobile phone

items.synopsis: Many Australians use phone apps to help track their periods, for convenience, contraception or to better understand fertility and reproductive health, but privacy experts warn they're not without risk.

title.children: Many Australians use period-tracker apps for convenience, but experts warn they could come at a cost

image.altText: A brass band plays during a flash mob in a shopping mall.

items.synopsis: Various versions of the pro-democracy protest anthem Glory to Hong Kong disappear from music streaming services including Apple's iTunes Store and Spotify after the city's government seeks an injunction banning the song.

title.children: Hong Kong protest anthem disappearing from streaming services as government seeks ban

image.altText: Worker near fertiliser bag

items.synopsis: In the hunt for cheaper fertiliser, has Australia imported incorrectly labelled and potentially risky product?

title.children: Farmers warned about unlabelled fertiliser, as imports rise from different supply chains

image.altText: A job recruitment billboard outside a doctors strike.

items.synopsis: SA health authorities resort to some unconventional tactics — described as both "ruthless" and "cheeky" — to recruit overseas doctors, parking billboards outside UK hospitals where doctors are on strike in a bid to lure them to Australia.

title.children: 'Cheeky' billboards outside UK hospitals as SA aims to poach striking doctors

image.altText: Aerial view Couran Cove Island resort

items.synopsis: Cheap waterfront properties are listed for sale at Couran Cove near the Gold Coast, but the real estate ads leave out an important detail — they have no power or water.

title.children: It's advertised as a 'resort-style paradise', but real estate ads ignore the fact it has no power or water

image.altText: A young, ginger-haired girl in a school uniform.

items.synopsis: Breanna Horsten was last seen in Albury, on the New South Wales-Victoria border, on June 7.

title.children: Police search for 10-year-old girl missing for more than a week

image.altText: Aboriginal people in a NT community - generic image

items.synopsis: Life outcomes for Indigenous Australians are continuing to worsen, as initiatives to Close the Gap offer mixed outcomes in the pursuit of ending systemic disadvantage.

title.children: Government says updated Closing the Gap data highlights need for structural change

image.altText: New Zealand trees down

items.synopsis: New Zealand is experiencing a recession after two quarters of negative GDP growth to March 2023, according to data released by Stats NZ.

title.children: New Zealand slips into shallow recession as bad weather takes toll

image.altText: The PwC logo is shown on an office building.

items.synopsis: PricewaterhouseCoopers began work on a top-level consulting contract with the federal government's regulator of tertiary colleges 24 hours before agreeing to acquire a $5.5 million stake in one such college, the controversial Top Education Group.

title.children: PwC worked for tertiary education regulator as it acquired stake in college

image.altText: A composite graphic featuring a financial graph overlaying a photo of two Ezidi men in Toowoomba, Queensland, 2023

items.synopsis: Financial pressure on households has never been higher, and more of us are spending beyond our means than ever before, according to a long-running survey.

title.children: Almost 2 million rental households struggling to make ends meet, new report finds
